channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Vehicle not moved in over 2 months, 11th June
item.description:
This was reported 3 weeks ago, all that is happened is someone has dusted the car. The car is still abandoned, and still taking up a perfectly good space. I believe that even if the owner wanted to move it, the car wouldn't even start it has been left for that long.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blyth Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cat litter and Faeces spread all over pavement and road, 11th June
item.description:
Someone is using a local bin to dispose of their cat litter. The bins are emptied on Mondays and are then left by the back of 16 Clevedon close for pick up on Tuesday. During the night the foxes get at the bin bags resulting cat litter & faeces everywhere

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clevedon Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Graffiti (Offensive or up to 2 meters off the ground)

item.title: Environmental hazard - CCTV Needed in this area, 11th June
item.description:
This path is constantly being abused with fly-tipping, human fouling, litter, and dog mess. It’s used daily by school kids, people with prams, and those on mobility scooters, making it really unsafe, especially with dangerous rubbish like paint cans, rusty rods and whatever else is lying around. I’ve asked before for CCTV to be installed here on this road. It would cost less than what you could recover in fines from those responsible for the fly tipping and dog fouling. Please take action, this area needs protecting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Middle Park Avenue, Middle Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Regular occurrence, 11th June
item.description:
This is a regular tipping occurrence from this HMO household. They have plenty of bins however decide to throw their rubbish on the pavement! This house had applications of rejections to become a HMO for one of these issues and the council said its not an issue!! It would be an issue if it happened outside your house!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kashgar Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
